definition: to scold/to abuse/to curse/CL:通[tong4],頓|顿[dun4]
net (Kangxi radical 122)
horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]
to insult/to revile/abuse/vituperation
to swear or curse (at people)/to scold or yell at someone
to beat and scold
to hurl abuse/to deride/to call sb names
to abuse roundly
to scold
to receive a scolding
to bawl out/to reprimand severely
to damn/to curse/to revile
to hurl abuse/to trade insults/slanging match
to swear while talking/to be foul-mouthed
to swear while talking/to be foul-mouthed
to verbally abuse
to tease a woman by pretending to be displeased with her/to flirt with a member of the opposite sex/to banter flirtatiously
tongue-lashing/to chew out/CL:頓|顿[dun4]

sentences.english: If she scolds you, it is because she cares for you.
sentences.chinese: 如果她罵你，是表示她“關心”你。

sentences.english: Heard this words, connect I scold the oneself shameless, what way of thinking.
sentences.chinese: 聽了這段話，連我都罵自己無恥，什麼思路。

sentences.english: On top of a tongue-lashing, he got a beating as well.
sentences.chinese: 他捱了罵不算，還捱了一頓打。

sentences.english: Brother scold by white Mary cried.
He turns and scolds a group of local fighters lounging at a nearby roadblock.
sentences.chinese: 他轉過身，罵了在附近的路障閒逛當地戰士組。

sentences.english: Mrs. Logan scolded her son for eating in the car.
sentences.chinese: 絡根太太罵她孩子在車裏喫東西。

sentences.english: Go into day-trading, and you'll see more vendors than you can shake a stick at .
sentences.chinese: 去做日內交易，你會發現你要罵的生意人太多了。

sentences.english: I can put their cursing, you can also get extremely admire.
sentences.chinese: 我可以把自己罵死，也可以把你自責得五體投地。

sentences.english: I don't normally blame anything on the refs.
White people were pointed at in the street and called "foreign devil".
sentences.chinese: 白種人走在街上都會被指着罵“洋鬼子”。

sentences.english: Relatives have scolded him, saying he is irresponsible.
sentences.chinese: 親戚們數落他，罵他是不孝子。

sentences.english: He chided the naughty children away.
sentences.chinese: 他把那些頑皮小孩罵走了。

sentences.english: Has she scolded you again lately?
sentences.chinese: 她近來還常常罵你嗎？”覺慧含笑道。

sentences.english: Just after doing that, he crushed into a group of pigs.
sentences.chinese: 纔剛罵完，他便迎頭撞上一羣過馬路的豬。

sentences.english: It is proper that you should scold him for his idleness.
sentences.chinese: 你罵他不求上進是應該的。

sentences.english: They shared movies, more fights, more cuss words.
sentences.chinese: 讓他們一起看電影，又打架罵髒話了。
